SENT.plain: Barrett's esophagus (BE) increases the risk for development of esophageal adenocarcinoma
Because of the rapid rise in incidence of esophageal adenocarcinoma, screening for BE with subsequent surveillance when found has been proposed as a method of early detection
Sedated endoscopy, however, is too expensive for wide spread screening
As a result, other techniques including unsedated transnasal esophagoscopy and capsule esophagoscopy have been proposed to expand screening programs
